isis.stitle: HYDRO-MAX™ BRAKE BOOSTER AND MASTER CYLINDER - INSTALL - FLOW SWITCH

svcproc.title: FLOW SWITCH
svcproc.para: For electrical diagnostic information, refer to Group 08 - ELECTRICAL in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.
Refer to Figure 6 for items in parentheses.

step1.para: Before installing the new flow switch (Item 1), examine flow switch cavity in the Hydro-Max™ booster (Item 3). Make sure the cavity is clean and undamaged.
Clean and inspect the flow switch piston and spring (Items 4 and 5) before installing them into the flow switch cavity of the Hydro-Max™ booster (Item 3).
Install the flow switch spring (Item 5) into the flow switch cavity, then install the flow switch piston (Item 4) into the flow switch cavity of the Hydro-Max™ booster (Item 3).
Install new O-ring (Item 2) onto the new flow switch (Item 1).
Thread the new flow switch contact assembly (Item 1) with new O-ring (Item 2) into the flow switch cavity in the Hydro-Max™ booster (Item 3). Tighten to 20 to 40 lbf-in (2.3 to 4.5 N•m).

svcproc.para: Refer to Figure 3 for all items in parentheses.

step1.para: Connect wiring harness flow switch connector (Item 8) to flow switch (Item 9).
Fill the power steering pump reservoir to the proper level.
Connect battery ground cable and unblock the vehicle wheels.

svcproc.para: Start engine. Once the engine is running, the power steering pump will circulate power steering fluid through the system. This will automatically purge air from the Hydro-Max™ booster. Press on the brake pedal several times to make sure the pedal feels normal. With the engine off, press on the brake pedal several times to make sure the pedal feels normal in the backup pump mode. Check the flow switch for leakage. Tighten if necessary. Check power steering pump reservoir level, add power steering fluid, if necessary. Road test the vehicle to make sure the vehicle stops properly.
